author: Staff Reporter
text:
The police have formed three special teams to arrest Venkatesan, a member of a fringe Dalit outfit in connection with the death of three students of SVS college of Naturopathy and Yoga Science.

Police sources said Venkatesan, an employee in the college and president of Adi-dravidar Puratchi Kazhagam, allegedly threatened to subdue the students for resorting to protests against lack of infrastructure and monetary exploitation by the management.

It is learnt that Venkatesan threatened the students with the backing of the management. He is absconding since the death of the three students and a manhunt has been launched to nab him.

Volunteers of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday resorted to a sit-in protest at the Government Medical College and Hospital at Mundiyambakkam demanding that the Government to transfer the probe to the Central Bureau of Investigation.

They wanted the Government to provide a compensation of Rs. 25 lakh to the victims’ families.

Security stepped up

Meanwhile, security has been stepped up at the Government Medical College and Hospital where the body of Monisha has been kept after a post-mortem. examination.

Police said Venkatesan allegedly threatened to subdue students for their protests
title: Hunt on for another staffer
